H0.text: Which South American capital was founded on the banks of the Rio Mapocho by Pedro de Valdivia in 1541. Buenos Aires

H1.text: Which South American capital was founded on the banks of the Rio Mapocho by Pedro de Valdivia in 1541. Lima

H2.text: Which South American capital was founded on the banks of the Rio Mapocho by Pedro de Valdivia in 1541. Quito

H3.text: Which South American capital was founded on the banks of the Rio Mapocho by Pedro de Valdivia in 1541. Stgo

A4.text: Valdivia later called a meeting with the local chiefs, during which he explained his plan to establish a city on behalf of Charles I of Spain.

A5.text: On 12 February 1541, Valdivia officially founded the city of Santiago del Nuevo Extremo ('Santiago of New Extremadura') in honor of the Apostle James, the patron saint of Spain.
